item.title: Website template
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:524848”]Look up jQuery if you have a hard time with JavaScript. It simplifies the shit out of everything, I like it very much.[/quote]That isn’t very good advice. One should learn how to use the language before learning libraries.

Read full topic

item.title: Website template
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Look up jQuery if you have a hard time with JavaScript. It simplifies the shit out of everything, I like it very much.

item.title: Website template
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:5, topic:524848”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=643538.msg4331689#msg4331689 date=1373736140]

There is no way I’m signing up for your forums just to download this.

Edit: Vain_ gave me the link and just by looking through this code I’m wondering why you’re still coding like this.

and all this internal styling

…
…
…
…
…
…
…
…

I still did it properly <hr class="sep">

Edit: the “strip” at the top was not a hr lol

<div id="htmlcaption4" style="display: none;"> <div style="width:190px;height:240px;display:inline-block;background:white url(images/caption4.gif) no-repeat 0 0;border-radius:4px;"></div> </div>

Also, you’re using an HTML doctype, why not use HTML5 tags?
[/quote]

not my code
http://www.menucool.com/javascript-image-slider

I don’t know JS very well so I used their code. There was no point in me fixing their code.[/quote]

It doesn’t matter if it isn’t yours, you should still fix it. It only makes your templates look more professional.

Read full topic
